text: Sir Keith Vivian Thomas (born 2 January 1933) is a Welsh historian. His area of focus is the history of the early modern world. He is best known for writing Religion and the Decline of Magic and Man and the Natural World. From 1986 to 2000, he was president of Corpus Christi College, Oxford. He was elected a member of the Academia Europaea in 1993. Thomas was born in Wick, Glamorgan. He is married to Lady Valerie Thomas and has two children. ==References== Category:1933 births Category:Living people Category:Academics of the University of Oxford Category:Welsh historians Category:Companions of Honour Category:Knights Bachelor Category:People from Glamorgan Category:Members of Academia Europaea
